alert.note: Alert for Harney County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 24 at 7:14AM PDT until April 25 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise ID has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oregon... Silvies River Near Burns affecting Harney County. .Rain over the weekend combined with snowmelt from warmer temperatures has resulted in increased river flows. River flows may continue to increase as runoff enters the river. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Silvies River Near Burns. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of fields will occur in the Burns area. Water will encroach on some private properties along North Broadway Avenue, Foley Road, and Stancliff Road. Water will be close to flowing on to Highway 20 at the Silvies River Bridge. Low spots in the Burns RV Park may be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM PDT Monday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 800 AM PDT.
